I tried using one URL and I tried the=C2=A0URL-Agnostic Duplication Reducti=
on =C2=A0which I believe does not required two different config for Store a=
nd Load however it does not seem to read the historical data. The only time=
 it works is when the same URL is encountered during a single crawl. Can an=
yone please send me a sample crawler-bean.xml for=C2=A0URL-Agnostic Duplica=
tion Reduction which has worked for them =C2=A0for historical crawls ?
Than=
ksSandip 

     On Saturday, 7 February 2015 9:51 AM, "Sandip Dev devsandip=
2511@... [archive-crawler]" <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
 =
  

 =C2=A0   
| Thanks Gordon will try that. I have a question though when=
 a revisit record is written is the resource physically written to the new =
archive or is it just a pointer record to a previous archive ? In case it i=
s just a pointer when we playback the new archive via openwayback will it s=
how a "resource not in archive " for the revisit resources if we dont keep =
the previous archive ?SandipSent from Yahoo Mail on Android 
|  From:"Gordo=
n Mohr gojomo@... [archive-crawler]" <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.c=
om>
Date:Sat, Feb 7, 2015 at 4:23 am
Subject:Re: [archive-crawler] Heritrix=
 3.2.0 deduplication

 =C2=A0   It can be helpful in such cases, when learn=
ing/testing a feature for the 
1st time, to make the crawls toy-sized. That=
 is, crawl just a single URI 
that you believe would be eligible for duplic=
ation-savings. Only when 
you're sure the configuration works for the singl=
e URI would you then 
expand to a more realistic crawl.

For example, you c=
ould try a crawl of just the static resource:

http://localhost:8081/artJQW=
eb/resources/core/main.css

In your first crawl, working with no prior stat=
e/history, you'd expect 
this URI to have a normal log-line. In a second cr=
awl that's set up 
properly to consult the first crawl's digest-history, it=
 should appear 
as a detected duplicate (and then only be written in the WA=
RC as a 
'revisit' record).

Until you have this working for one URI, revie=
w your configuration, and 
make sure the 2nd crawl is properly consulting t=
he history-info from the 
first.

- Gordon

evsandip2511@... [archive-crawler]

> f=
or both runs. Do you think it looks ok to you as the warc size remains
> sa=
me for both crawl?
>

bsite so do I need

r
> crawl=E2=80=94did you delete Heritrix=E2=80=99s state directory before =
testing? If not,
> Heritrix will try and deduplicate based on the earlier, =
stored metadata.

ation Reduction .

ite and as all the contents were already present in the first

but the size of the archieve still remained 312 kb.

nging anything on the site I was

> On Fri=

> [archive-=
crawler]" <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
> Hi Sandip,
> As far as=
 I=E2=80=99m aware you should definitely be using only one of the
> =E2=80=
=9CURL-Agnostic Duplication Reduction=E2=80=9D or the =E2=80=9CLegacy=E2=80=
=A6=E2=80=9D version. Although
> they largely do the same thing they behave=
 differently (effectively the
> newer version keys on the checksum, the old=
er keys on the URL+checksum).
> At first glance your config. looks correct =
so it might be the inclusion
> of both the above causing the issue. During =
a crawl, if you watch your
> crawl.log file, you should see entries with an=
notations like
> =E2=80=9CwarcRevisit:digest=E2=80=9D in the last field=E2=
=80=94that indicates deduplication is
> working.
> Roger
> *From:*archive-c=
rawler@yahoogroups.com

rong ?

L-Agnostic Duplication Reduction

tion

work :)

=3D"0" border=3D"0"><tbody><tr><td colspan=3D"1" rowspan=3D"1" valign=3D"to=
p"><div dir=3D"ltr"><font size=3D"2"><font size=3D"2">Thanks Gordon will tr=
y that. I have a question though when a revisit record is written is the re=
source physically written to the new archive or is it just a pointer record=
 to a previous archive ? In case it is just a pointer when we playback the =
new archive via openwayback will it show a "resource not in archive " for t=
he revisit resources if we dont keep the previous archive ?</font></font></=
div>
<div dir=3D"ltr"><u><font size=3D"2"><font size=3D"2">Sandip</font></f=
ont></u></div>
<div dir=3D"ltr"><font size=3D"2"><font size=3D"2"><a rel=3D=

 <table cellspacing=3D"0" cellpadding=3D"0" border=3D"0"><tbo=

amily:Roboto, sans-serif;color:#7e7d80;">From:"Gordon Mohr gojomo@archive.o=

<div class=3D"yiv9925448991yqt0288674097" i=

=3D"yiv9925448991ygrp-msg">


    <div id=3D"yiv9925448991ygrp-text">
     =
 
      
      <div>It can be helpful in such cases, when learning/testing =
a feature for the <br clear=3D"none">
1st time, to make the crawls toy-size=
d. That is, crawl just a single URI <br clear=3D"none">
that you believe wo=
uld be eligible for duplication-savings. Only when <br clear=3D"none">
you'=
re sure the configuration works for the single URI would you then <br clear=
=3D"none">
expand to a more realistic crawl.<br clear=3D"none">
<br clear=
=3D"none">
For example, you could try a crawl of just the static resource:<=
br clear=3D"none">
<br clear=3D"none">
http://localhost:8081/artJQWeb/resou=
rces/core/main.css<br clear=3D"none">
<br clear=3D"none">
In your first cra=
wl, working with no prior state/history, you'd expect <br clear=3D"none">
t=
his URI to have a normal log-line. In a second crawl that's set up <br clea=
r=3D"none">
properly to consult the first crawl's digest-history, it should=
 appear <br clear=3D"none">
as a detected duplicate (and then only be writt=
en in the WARC as a <br clear=3D"none">
'revisit' record).<br clear=3D"none=
">
<br clear=3D"none">
Until you have this working for one URI, review your=
 configuration, and <br clear=3D"none">
make sure the 2nd crawl is properly=
 consulting the history-info from the <br clear=3D"none">
first.<br clear=
=3D"none">
<br clear=3D"none">
- Gordon<br clear=3D"none">
<br clear=3D"non=
e">
